page.title: 06Schools
page.content: There is only one school in the square, Shenington CE Primary. All children normally attend the Warriner School at Bloxham when aged 11. Children from Shutford attend North Newington CE Aided school (2 miles away). Transport by bus is provided free. July 1985 - 34 children attended the school. Shutford Village school closed in 1963. 76% of children attend their normal state school, 17% private, 7% others. West Shutford National school was opened in 1869 with 45 pupils. By 1893 the average attendance was 61. By the time of its closure in 1963 it had 11 pupils. Shenington schoolis 107 years old & is made of Hornton stone. The roof is of stonesfield slate.There are 48 children. When it was built it was said it would hold 90 children. The first pupil was Henry Hawtin in 1878.
